data.title: Remove unused Core Team Project Management labels
data.body: Some Core Team labels aren't used anymore. To prevent misleading our users, we are removing these labels from the CONTRIBUTING document.

data.title: PHP -Weird string syntax highlighting
data.body:
I have had a couple of occasions where the syntax highlighting will turn parts of a string blue (same color as a function) whenever a '/' is used.

I personally don't see any point to this, and even if there is, it should use a different, more subtle color rather then the same aqua-blue as functions use.

Examples:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4212335/13015542/00f56e46-d1ba-11e5-8a81-3684830474fb.png)

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4212335/13015576/20c22548-d1ba-11e5-85a8-b2a0287dd0df.png)

data.title: Atom is not updating the open tabs when I checkout a different Git branch
data.body:
Hello,

It often happens that when I switch between the branch with Git, Atom doesn't update the files that are different between branches and that are opened in the editor. If I close and reopen the tab, the file gets properly updated, but that is annoying anyway. Do you have the same issue?

My version is 1.4.0.

Cheers,
Flavio

data.title: Fix TextEditorPresenter spec timeout.
data.body:
Fixes #10435.

I haven’t been able to reproduce this locally yet, but let’s see if it’s as easy as giving it a longer timeout.

data.title: Atom does not mark files with uncommitted changes in the file system browser
data.body:
`Atom v1.5.2`
![screenshot from 2016-02-12 16 21 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11234616/13004956/ad355c36-d1a4-11e5-99d2-d9a2f350bdca.png)
You can see that the file has uncommitted changes (the yellow lines) in the screenshot above.
![screenshot from 2016-02-12 16 18 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11234616/13004976/dade2d3e-d1a4-11e5-8335-4de02b851b1e.png)
Atom marks them after I press `ctrl + s` but after they go away when the window goes out of focus.

I lost code because of this.

data.title: Upgrade autocomplete-plus to use new text-buffer API
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/pull/659

What's missing:
- [x] `apm publish -t v2.27.1` for autocomplete-plus (it's currently failing with `Application Error`)

@maxbrunsfeld: I noticed you published a new version of autocomplete-plus but didn't upgrade it on atom/atom. The new version I plan to publish will include your changes: are you okay with this? Is there anything you were waiting for before updating ac+?

data.title: Installer not connecting to internet behind corporate proxy
data.body:
Hey,

I already have an older version of atom installed, anyhow I have issues with proxy with a running atom so I considered to install the new version with the installer.

I am sitting behind a corporate proxy on win7 x64 machine - I have my environment variables correct on windows, I have configured my .apmrc with http-proxy, https-proxy and proxy variable correct.
Besides atom is not able to communicate with the internet with this settings even the new installer is crashing upon starting it, see attached log telling me

> 2015-09-01 13:28:40> Program: Starting Squirrel Updater: --install .
> 2015-09-01 13:28:40> Program: Starting install, writing to C:\Users\foo\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp
> 2015-09-01 13:28:40> Program: About to install to: C:\Users\foo\AppData\Local\atom
> 2015-09-01 13:28:40> CheckForUpdateImpl: Failed to load local releases, starting from scratch: System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Ein Teil des Pfades "C:\Users\foo\AppData\Local\atom\packages\RELEASES" konnte nicht gefunden werden.
>    bei System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
>    bei System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)
>    bei System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share)
>    bei Squirrel.Utility.LoadLocalReleases(String localReleaseFile)
>    bei Squirrel.UpdateManager.CheckForUpdateImpl.<CheckForUpdate>d__3a.MoveNext()
> 2015-09-01 13:28:40> CheckForUpdateImpl: Reading RELEASES file from C:\Users\foo\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp
> 2015-09-01 13:28:40> CheckForUpdateImpl: First run or local directory is corrupt, starting from scratch
> 2015-09-01 13:28:40> ApplyReleasesImpl: Writing files to app directory: C:\Users\foo\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.9
> 2015-09-01 13:28:54> ApplyReleasesImpl: Squirrel Enabled Apps: [C:\Users\foo\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.9\atom.exe]
> 2015-09-01 13:28:56> ApplyReleasesImpl: Starting fixPinnedExecutables
> 2015-09-01 13:28:56> ApplyReleasesImpl: fixPinnedExecutables: oldAppDirectories is empty, this is pointless
> 2015-09-01 13:28:56> ApplyReleasesImpl: cleanDeadVersions: for version 1.0.9

data.title: Atom not responding
data.body:
When I pin the window to a side of a screen, it stops responding visually. I can still type and delete, but I won't see any changes unless I unpin the window, resize it, or minimize and get it back.

So, I start the program through the command prompt, drag the window to the side of the screen so it would pin there (Windows 10), and it stops responding. Pinning it to the corners (so it takes up a quarter of the screen) works fine.

data.title: How to get script/build to use local sources and not download the sources itself
data.body:
Hi,

I am attempting to create an Open Build Service (OBS) repository for Atom so that openSUSE users like myself can update Atom automatically, without having to download the RPM from the home page /  the releases page for this repo with every new release. To be able to do this, I need to know how to get script/build to use local sources instead of trying to download the required sources (like for its node modules, apm packages, _etc._) itself. I'm not a Node.js expert (or even someone with an intermediate knowledge of it) so please, just tell me:
1. Does script/build have an in-built option that can be passed to it so that it will use local packages instead of downloading them itself? If so what is it?
2. If not, how do I build Atom using local sources via alternate routes? Preferably in as simple terms as possible.

Thanks for your time and patience,
Brenton

data.title: findOrCreateBottommostSibling not working as expected
Shrink modals when window gets narrow
Mouse click release not being detected in text area
data.body: Just upgraded from v1.4.3 to 1.5.2 and now when I click in the code editor, and I move my mouse, it highlights the text as if I was still holding the mouse button down. Reinstalled Atom and also tried Atom 1.6 Beta, same issue occurs in that release. My OS is Ubuntu 15.10 (64-bit). Never had this issue ever before with Atom. This issue only happens in the text area (i.e. I cannot click on a file in the project directory, move my mouse and have it dragged to wherever.) If I actually highlight text and release my mouse button, the issue does not happen.

data.title: Cannot delete project files on Windows 7
data.body:
When clicking at "delete" button, it asks for moving file to trash. When confirming, it does nothing.

Can't use an editor that doesn't exclude files!! Too basic!!

``` coffee
git-control, v0.7.0
linter-coffeelint, v1.1.2
```

data.title: Issue when trying to start Nodemon
Spawn/ENOENT thrown if the app is moved while it is open
data.body: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9594 is a good example of this.

data.title: Highlight selected word / variable
data.body:
As it is in Notepad++ for example, it would be great if a word or variable would be highlighted if it is selected (double clicked).

Of course, there is a package [https://atom.io/packages/highlight-selected] for that, but why not integrate this function as default? There is no other action, which would be blocked by that.

data.title: issue in installer handling dates in Microsoft Windows OS
data.body:
I had updated Atom on the last week of January, 2016.
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6317196/12975459/ee0de214-d0e1-11e5-89c4-347f2ec9c061.PNG)
But, when I opened the Programs and Features window, I saw the date as above. (which was funny)

I do not know whether this is a bug with Atom, but since other installed applications do not have this problem I am assuming that it is a bug with atom.

Please fix this as late as possible, as this is not at all urgent.

data.title: Clicking on empty space below long line freezes Atom
data.body:
I'm aware of #979, but I'm not entirely sure this is the same issue, and if it is, this may be helpful info that I can't add to the issue b/c it's locked.

To reproduce, open a large one line file. This example creates a file with 150k `#`'s and opens Atom in safe mode. (And make sure soft wrap is disabled?)

``` sh
dd if=/dev/zero ibs=1k count=150 | tr "\000" "#" > hashes.txt
atom --safe hashes.txt
```

Then click on the empty non-numbered space below the first line. This causes Atom to move the cursor to the end of the long first line. Unfortunately, Atom freezes for about ~30s on my MBP before the cursor move is complete.

Clicking anywhere _on_ the line doesn't cause a freeze, nor does navigating with the keyboard. Even pressing the end key moves the cursor to the end of the line instantly.

Here's a profile of that frozen period:

![hashes txt users rahat downloads 2016-02-10 22-26-27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3174006/12969392/5c795f6e-d045-11e5-987a-d90de690de31.png)

I figure this is different than #979 because the frozen period involves figuring out cursor position and not syntax highlighting, as the profiles in that issue imply.

Confirmed on both Windows 10 and El Capitan on Atom v1.5.1

data.title: Temporarily disable deserializers & viewProviders metadata fields
data.body:
See https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10764

After merging the above PR in master, I'd like to avoid waiting for v1.7.0 to be released before I can merge PRs that update packages to use the new deserializer and view-provider APIs. I can change the packages in a backwards-compatible way, but I need to temporarily remove the logic that I added in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/9687 for handling the slightly-different API that I had introduced previously.

This should be pretty risk-free, since it just removes calls to some methods that I recently added. Once it goes :green_heart:, my intent is to merge it directly into stable and publish a new patch release, just to unblock continuing efforts to use the improved APIs.

/cc @nathansobo

data.title: Feature Request: Open project from within Windows Libraries view
data.body: I just noticed that when attempting to open a project that also shares a location within a Windows Libraries location (Windows 7 in this case) a context menu option to open with Atom is not present when selecting within the directory area (blank space in the right pane). I'm fairly certain this is either something overlooked or possibly due to the way Windows treats these directories as symbolic links. Right clicking for the context menu option for a directory within the tree view for a project presents the "Open with Atom" context option, just within the right pane it does not.
